Review Text:
Delicious, fresh ingredients, speedy and very friendly staff.
For an Italian, all Pizzas in Amsterdam are over priced but this one is worth it considering you will need to pay the same for any competing pizza of similar quality.

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: Cosy environment and top class pizza!

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: Simple, no fuss place with excellent pizza. The pizzas are wood fired and are the main item on the menu, some desserts as well but not much else. Wine is well-priced, beer options are not so great. No reservations so you may need to wait for a table, especially on weekends.

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: Pizza was definitely delicious, but the prices are way to high. While the waiter was really kind and considerate, I consider 18‚Ç¨ for a pizza and a drink way too much. If it weren't for the prices, I'd recommend it. However, it might just be that some consider this being cheap. If you do, don't mind my review and go check it out.

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: Authentic Italian pizza, for my opinion the best of Amsterdam! .. always very friendly and professional italian staff that use only fresh high quality ingredients. Sinds 1 year is also improved. Thanks for your nice smile ..l'm Italian as ‚Ä¶

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: This place was great! When we went in the evening, we were the only two there for a time. We both ordered margherita pizzas which were made in a wood oven within our view. We also had a bottle of great red wine, and the prices were very ‚Ä¶

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: 1. the food : would say better then average, expect fresh, and quality Italian ingredients. ( but a pizza cost between 13 and 17 euro  ) they use a brick oven with wood as heating. ‚Ä¶

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: Ordered via Ubereats and it took 75 min to deliver, much longer than the advocated 30min. There are no more dine-in due to lockdown so they should be very free. Totally unacceptable to wait that long when you are spending more than 30 euros for pizza

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: Best Italian pizza in Amsterdam, no doubt. Please burn it less if possible because we love it so much, we can't imagine to have to take a crumb out. The marinara is wonderful. And it is the way it should be.

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: One of the best pizza places in Amsterdam featuring  a proper food fired oven. Limited seating area but they do takeout. On busy days expect a little wait until you get your pizza but it's well worth it.

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: Bad start as the waiter forgot my drink order, when I finally got it the glass was dirty. Food was good until i found a long black hair baked into my pizza so I sent it back and kindly refused their offer of free coffee and dessert. To top everything off I had to pay for the meal!

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: Best Pizza of Amsterdam. Authentic Italian.

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: The pizza delivered is among the worst I have ever seen/had. Ingredients and aspect are similar to what you can buy for 3Euro from AH - but I do trust that AH pizzas (even when taken from the freezer) are warmer that what you get on delivery. Horrible service with zero respect for your customers!

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: It‚Äôs good but not great.  The meat : ham  tasted ok.

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: Great for takeaway pizzas when you call ahead to order. Sitting in the restaurant is a bit cramped and food can take a while to come out. Pizzas themselves are always very tasty and they have a nice variety of toppings.

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: It a bit small space but it worth it, because pizza that I ordered was amazing. Also house wine is good, even though you do not get them in a wine glass. I recommend it. Go, try and enjoy!

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: Our favourite pizza place in Amsterdam. Take aways or sit in. Real Italians baking pizza in a wood oven. Can get hot inside on summer days. Why not 5 stars? Sometimes the quality is not the best.  But that does not happen a lot.

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: It used to be one of my favorite places, but now almost always it is really too busy with online orders, so you can spend standing 10 min in front of them, and they wouldn‚Äôt even acknowledge. Pizza is good usually, service is pretty bad. Disappointed again.

Review Text: I had a pizza there for ‚Ç¨15.50. the pizza was not bad, but unfortunately parts of it were burnt, it was really dry, and there was way too much oregano on it. So it wasn't that nice to eat unfortunately.

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: Amazingly delicious wood oven pizza and great friendly service.  Simple quality ingredients makes a perfect pizza anytime. Loved it!!

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text:
There is something magical about a well crafted pizza, baked in a proper wood fired stone oven.
I highly recommend this visiting place, if you're interested in experiencing how a proper pizza should taste.

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: BEST food we had in Amsterdam. The staff is very friendly. The restaurant is small so you may have to wait for a table but the food is absolutely worth the wait. There are some great bars in the area to grab a drink in the meantime. GO TO PAZZI.

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: (Translated by Google) If you like those wafer-thin pizzas, as you get in Italy, then this is highly recommended. You have to be lucky to get a spot though, as they only have 116 seats (plus a bar for 4). You can also pick up here. ‚Ä¶

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: (Translated by Google) I went to dinner with them, I am Italian and I live in Rome and the pizza is exceptional, highly digestible and the products used are of the highest quality !! What attracted me was the wood oven !! ‚Ä¶

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: (Translated by Google) Italian Pizzeria with Italian Staff. You can eat in a bar or in 4 tables in the interior. We tasted 3 pizzas of the menu and very good. They are simple pizzas but the base is thin with crunchy edges, the quality ‚Ä¶

Name: Pazzi Italian Slow Food
Review Text: (Translated by Google) When it's busy you have to work hard, I get that. Nevertheless, the simple take-away pizza for which I pay 14 euros must have been prepared with care. And it wasn't: soft bottom, too much cheese, 3 sprigs of tomato ‚Ä¶
